title.narrative: Church Appeal FundsLivelihood Support to IDPs and Host Community in Tonj North County, Warrap State.

description.narrative: Trocaire has allocated some funds to respond to the needs of the displaced and vulnerable members of the host community who are affected by localized conflict in Tonj North of Warrap state. The funds is coming from the Church Appeal Funds, and will be implemented by farmer CTP partner (HARD), based in Wau. Through this intervention HARD will directly target 800 HH smallholder farmers who are Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) and host community Households (HHs) to be supported with farm inputs (seeds and hand tools) in the coming agriculture season (2022). About 250 elderly and people with disability including pregnant and lactating mothers will be supported through social Protection program (SPP) with unconditional cash transfer to enable them have access to food and other basic needs. Sixty (60) of the selected farmers will be provided with assorted vegetable seeds and will be trained to engage in vegetable production in the areas to diversify their dietary intake and income generation. About 60 female headed households will be provided with small ruminant for rearing and sale during the hunger gap for income generation. It is envisioned that through this project about 400 IDPs HH will also be provided with a dignified NFI Kits and 30 HH will benefit from the fishing equipment (hooks and twines)
